00010 // -- CLASS DESCRIPTION --
00011 // Dalitz plot amplitude for D0->pi+pi-pi0
00012 //
00013 //Note: The BdkAbsDDalitzAmp class consturct the pdf for D0->pi0 pi+ pi-
00014 //Here I specific the phase convection:
00015 //s12 -> pi0 pi+ 
00016 //s13 -> pi0 pi- 
00017

00045 
00046 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::normalizeAll(int nEvents){ 
00047   // Normalize all objects
00048   cout << "----- BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::normalizeAll: normalizing " << _registry.size()
00049        << " objects with " << nEvents << " events each." << endl
00050        << "Note: Only objects whose PDFs have been created are normalized."
00051        << endl
00052        << "To force the creation of a PDF call its wrapper's parameters()." 
00053        << endl;
00054 
00055   for (int i = 0; i < _registry.size(); ++i){
00056     cout << "Normalizing " << _registry[i]->GetName() << endl;
00057     _registry[i]->calNorm(nEvents);
00058     _registry[i]->normParams().Print("V");
00059   }
00060 }

00063 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::registerObject(BdkAbsDDalitzAmp * amp) {
00064   cout << "BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::Registry: registering " << amp->GetName() << endl;

00066 }
00067 
00068 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::deregisterObject(BdkAbsDDalitzAmp * amp) {
00069   remove(_registry.begin(),_registry.end(),amp);
00070 }
00071 
00072 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::cleanRegistry() {
00073   _registry.clear();
00074 }

00102 // link our parameters to the pdf:
00103 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::registerParams(BdkDalitzBase * pdf)
00104 {
00105   if (pdf==0) {
00106     //    cout << GetName()<< ".registerParams(): Cannot register parameters for NULL pdf."
00107     //         << endl;
00108     return;
00109   }
00110   
00111   RooListProxy * proxyList = 
00112     new RooListProxy(TString(GetName()) + ".proxyList",
00113                      TString(GetTitle()) + " proxyList",
00114                      pdf);
00115   
00116   TIterator*  tIter = _params.createIterator();
00117   RooAbsArg*  coef;
00118   while(coef = (RooAbsArg*)tIter->Next()) {
00119     if (!dynamic_cast<RooAbsReal*>(coef)) assert(0);
00120     proxyList->add(*coef);
00121   }
00122   delete tIter;
00123 
00124   // also link the normalization parameters:
00125   tIter = _normParams.createIterator();
00126   while(coef = (RooAbsArg*)tIter->Next()) {
00127     if (!dynamic_cast<RooAbsReal*>(coef)) assert(0);
00128     proxyList->add(*coef);
00129   }
00130   delete tIter;
00131 }

00140 
00141 //Return the normalization
00142 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::getNormalization() const 
00143 {  
00144   Double_t norm = 0;
00145 
00146   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {
00147 
00148     Double_t amp_j = _ampRes[j]->getVal();
00149     if (amp_j==0) continue;
00150 
00151     RooComplex coeff_j(amp_j * cos(_phaseRes[j]->getVal()*DEGTORAD),
00152                        amp_j * sin(_phaseRes[j]->getVal()*DEGTORAD));
00153 
00154     for(int k=0;k<_nComps;k++){
00155    
00156       Double_t amp_k = _ampRes[k]->getVal();
00157       if (amp_k==0) continue;
00158 
00159       RooComplex coeff_k(amp_k * cos(_phaseRes[k]->getVal()*DEGTORAD),
00160                          amp_k * sin(_phaseRes[k]->getVal()*DEGTORAD));
00161 
00162       RooComplex normCoeff(_normReal[j][k]->getVal(), 
00163                            _normImag[j][k]->getVal());
00164 
00165       norm += ((coeff_j*coeff_k.conj()) * normCoeff).re();
00166     }
00167   }  
00168   return norm;
00169 }
00170

00172 
00173 //Return the normalization
00174 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::unNormalizedFitFraction(int j) const 
00175 {  
00176   RooComplex coeff_j(_ampRes[j]->getVal() * cos(_phaseRes[j]->getVal()*DEGTORAD),
00177                      _ampRes[j]->getVal() * sin(_phaseRes[j]->getVal()*DEGTORAD));
00178   
00179   RooComplex normCoeff(_normReal[j][j]->getVal(), 
00180                        _normImag[j][j]->getVal());
00181   
00182   Double_t fraction = ((coeff_j * coeff_j.conj()) * normCoeff).re();
00183   return fraction;
00184 }

00187 // Returns the fit fractions. Causes a memory leak, but who cares... 
00188 RooArgSet BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::fitFractions() const {
00189   Double_t norm = getNormalization();
00190   RooArgSet result;
00191   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {  
00192     TString name("FitFraction_");
00193     name += _nameRes[j];
00194     RooRealVar * var = new RooRealVar(name, name, 
00195                                       unNormalizedFitFraction(j) / norm);
00196     result.add(*var);
00197   }
00198   return result;
00199 }

00205 //Return the normalization integral over the isospin amplitudes
00206 // Valid only for D0-->pi+pi-pi0 decay.
00207  
00208 RooArgSet BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::IntegralOverIsospin() const {    
00209 
00210   RooComplex ampcoeff(0.0, 0.0);
00211   RooComplex normcoeff(0.0, 0.0);
00212   RooComplex amp(0.0, 0.0);
00213   RooComplex amp_NR(0.0, 0.0);
00214   RooComplex amp_rhoP(0.0, 0.0);
00215   RooComplex amp_rho0(0.0, 0.0);
00216   RooComplex amp_rhoM(0.0, 0.0);
00217   RooComplex amp_F(0.0, 0.0);
00218 
00219   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {   
00220 
00221     ampcoeff = RooComplex(_ampRes[j]->getVal() * 
00222                           cos(_phaseRes[j]->getVal()*DEGTORAD),
00223                           _ampRes[j]->getVal() * 
00224                           sin(_phaseRes[j]->getVal()*DEGTORAD));  
00225     normcoeff = RooComplex(_normReal[j][j]->getVal(), 
00226                            _normImag[j][j]->getVal());
00227 
00228     amp = ampcoeff * sqrt(normcoeff.re());
00229   
00230 
00231     if (_nameRes[j].Contains("Nonres",TString::kExact)) { 
00232       amp_NR = amp_NR + amp; 
00233     }
00234 
00235     if(_nameRes[j].Contains("Rho+",TString::kExact) || 
00236        _nameRes[j].Contains("Rho2s+",TString::kExact) || 
00237        _nameRes[j].Contains("Rho1700+",TString::kExact)) { 
00238       amp_rhoP = amp_rhoP + amp; 
00239     }
00240 
00241     if(_nameRes[j].Contains("Rho-",TString::kExact) || 
00242        _nameRes[j].Contains("Rho2s-",TString::kExact) || 
00243        _nameRes[j].Contains("Rho1700-",TString::kExact)) { 
00244       amp_rhoM = amp_rhoM + amp; 
00245     }
00246 
00247     if(_nameRes[j].Contains("Rho0",TString::kExact) || 
00248        _nameRes[j].Contains("Rho2s0",TString::kExact) || 
00249        _nameRes[j].Contains("Rho17000",TString::kExact)) { 
00250       amp_rho0 = amp_rho0 + amp; 
00251     }
00252 
00253     if(_nameRes[j].Contains("F0",TString::kExact) || 
00254        _nameRes[j].Contains("F0_1370",TString::kExact) || 
00255        _nameRes[j].Contains("F0_1500",TString::kExact) ||
00256        _nameRes[j].Contains("F0_1710",TString::kExact) ||
00257        _nameRes[j].Contains("F2",TString::kExact) ||
00258        _nameRes[j].Contains("Sigma",TString::kExact)) { 
00259       amp_F = amp_F + amp; 
00260     }
00261   }
00262 
00263   RooArgSet normisospin;
00264   Double_t norm = getNormalization();
00265 
00266   RooRealVar* var1 = new RooRealVar("isospin-norm-NR", "isospin-norm-NR",
00267                                     amp_NR.abs()/ sqrt(norm));
00268   normisospin.add(*var1);
00269 
00270   RooRealVar* var2 = new RooRealVar("isospin-norm-rhoP", "isospin-norm-rhoP", 
00271                                    amp_rhoP.abs()/  sqrt(norm));
00272   normisospin.add(*var2);
00273 
00274   RooRealVar* var3 = new RooRealVar("isospin-norm-rho0", "isospin-norm-rho0", 
00275                                     amp_rho0.abs()/ sqrt(norm));
00276   normisospin.add(*var3);
00277 
00278   RooRealVar* var4 = new RooRealVar("isospin-norm-rhoM", "isospin-norm-rhoM", 
00279                                     amp_rhoM.abs()/ sqrt(norm));
00280   normisospin.add(*var4);
00281 
00282   RooRealVar* var5 = new RooRealVar("isospin-norm-F", "isospin-norm-F", 
00283                                     amp_F.abs()/ sqrt(norm));
00284   normisospin.add(*var5);
00285 
00286   return normisospin;
00287 }

00292 //Return the unnormalization integral over the Breit-Wigner amplitude only:
00293 // Integral_r =  \int |BW_r(s+, s-)|^2 ds+ ds- 
00294 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::IntegralOverBreitWigner(int j) const 
00295 {    
00296   RooComplex coeff(_normReal[j][j]->getVal(), _normImag[j][j]->getVal());
00297   
00298   Double_t integral = coeff.abs();
00299   return integral;
00300 }
00301 
00302 
00303 // Returns the square-root of the normalization integral over the 
00304 // Breit-Wigner amplitude: sqrt( Integral_r / norm )
00305 RooArgSet BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::BreitWignerNormalizationCoefficients() const {
00306   Double_t norm = getNormalization();
00307   RooArgSet fraction;
00308   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {  
00309     Double_t val = sqrt(IntegralOverBreitWigner(j) / norm);
00310     RooRealVar * var = new RooRealVar( TString("BWFraction_")+ _nameRes[j], 
00311                                        "", val);
00312     fraction.add(*var);
00313   }
00314   return fraction;
00315 }

00318 
00319 
00320 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::calNorm(int events, Bool_t enforceNormalizeAll) 
00321 {
00322   if (enforceNormalizeAll) {
00323     // Caller is enforcing normalization of all components
00324     setNeedToNormalizeAll();
00325 
00326     cout << GetName() 
00327          << ": BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::calNorm(): performing MC integration on all components" 
00328          << endl;
00329   }
00330 
00331   if (kFALSE == needToNormalizeAny()) {
00332     // No need to normalize. Note that this won't happen if enforceNormalizeall
00333     // is true.
00334     return;
00335   }
00336 
00337   if (verbose().Contains("n")) {
00338     cout << GetName() << ": start normalization" << endl;;
00339   }
00340 
00341   Double_t m12gen, m13gen;
00342   RooComplex normArray[SIZE][SIZE]; 
00343 
00344   Double_t m12Range = m12NormRange();
00345   Double_t m13Range = m13NormRange();
00346   
00347   for(int i=0;i<events;i++) {    
00348     m12gen = RooRandom::uniform()*m12Range;
00349     m13gen = RooRandom::uniform()*m13Range;
00350     
00351     if (inDalitz(m12gen,m13gen)) {
00352 
00353       for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {
00354         // Get the Breit-Wigner and spin terms
00355         Double_t Spin_j = SpinFactor(m12gen, m13gen, _spinRes[j], 
00356                                      _trackinfo[j],j);
00357         
00358         RooComplex BW_j = RelativisticBW(m12gen, m13gen, 
00359                                          _massRes[j]->getVal(), 
00360                                          _gammaRes[j]->getVal(),j);
00361 
00362         // use symmetry of normalization constants: N_jk = (N_kj)*
00363         for(int k=j;k<_nComps;k++){
00364           //check if component k or j needs to be normalized:
00365           if (needToNormalize(k) || needToNormalize(j)) {
00366             
00367             Double_t Spin_k = SpinFactor(m12gen, m13gen, _spinRes[k], 
00368                                          _trackinfo[k],k);
00369             
00370             RooComplex BW_k = RelativisticBW(m12gen, m13gen, 
00371                                              _massRes[k]->getVal(), 
00372                                              _gammaRes[k]->getVal(),k);
00373             
00374             RooComplex integral = (BW_j*BW_k.conj()*Spin_j*Spin_k) * 
00375               efficiency(m12gen,m13gen);
00376             
00377             normArray[j][k] = normArray[j][k] + integral;
00378           }
00379         }
00380       }
00381     }  //end the inDalitz if loop
00382 
00383     //give a status report when user asked for normalization:
00384     if(enforceNormalizeAll && fmod(i,events/10.0)==0) {
00385       cout << "Done with " << i << " events" << endl;
00386     }
00387   } //end the for loop
00388 
00389   // Convert the temporary normArray to RRV's that can be read in like
00390   // any other PDF parameter:
00391   
00392   const Double_t normArea = m12Range*m13Range;
00393   
00394   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {
00395     for(int k=j;k<_nComps;k++){
00396       if (needToNormalize(k) || needToNormalize(j)) {
00397         _normReal[j][k]->setVal((normArray[j][k]*normArea/events).re());
00398         _normImag[j][k]->setVal((normArray[j][k]*normArea/events).im());
00399 
00400         // use symmetry of normalization constants: N_jk = (N_kj)*
00401         _normReal[k][j]->setVal(_normReal[j][k]->getVal());
00402         _normImag[k][j]->setVal((-1)*_normImag[j][k]->getVal());
00403         
00404       }
00405     }
00406   }
00407 
00408   setIsNormalized();
00409 
00410   // Calculate normalization for D/Dbar interference
00411   calDDbarNorm(events);
00412 
00413   if (verbose().Contains("n")) {
00414     cout << GetName() << ": end normalization" << endl;
00415   }
00416 }
00417 
00418 // Helper function to calcualte the normalization integral of this
00419 // amplitude with a second amplitude given in amp2.
00420 // If amp==0 then use m12<->m13 flipped amplitude as amp2.
00421 // Return vector of normalization coefficient p0,...,p3.
00422 TVectorD BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::calDIntNorm(BdkAbsDDalitzAmp* amp2, int nEvents) const
00423 {
00424   Double_t p0 = 0; 
00425   Double_t p1 = 0; 
00426   Double_t p2 = 0; 
00427   Double_t p3 = 0; 
00428  
00429   Double_t m12Range = m12NormRange();
00430   Double_t m13Range = m13NormRange();
00431   
00432   for(Double_t i=0;i<nEvents;i++) {       
00433     Double_t m12gen = RooRandom::uniform()*m12Range;
00434     Double_t m13gen = RooRandom::uniform()*m13Range;
00435     
00436     if(inDalitz(m12gen,m13gen)) {
00437 
00438 
00439       RooComplex Damp = getamp(m12gen, m13gen);
00440       RooComplex Dbaramp(0,0);
00441 
00442       // amplitude calculated with appropriately charge-flipped variables
00443       // or using second amplitude
00444       if (amp2) Dbaramp = amp2->getamp(m12gen, m13gen);
00445       else Dbaramp = getamp(m13gen,m12gen);
00446 
00447       p0 += ((Dbaramp)*(Damp.conj())).re();
00448       p1 += ((Dbaramp)*(Damp.conj())).im();
00449       p2 += Dbaramp.abs2();
00450       p3 += Damp.abs2();
00451       
00452     }  //end the if loop
00453   } //end the for loop
00454 
00455   const Double_t normArea = m12Range*m13Range;
00456     
00457   p0 = p0*normArea/nEvents;
00458   p1 = p1*normArea/nEvents;
00459   p2 = p2*normArea/nEvents;
00460   p3 = p3*normArea/nEvents;
00461 
00462   TVectorD v(4);
00463   v[0] = p0;
00464   v[1] = p1;
00465   v[2] = p2;
00466   v[3] = p3;
00467   return v;
00468 }
00469 
00470 
00471 // Calculates the four normalization coefficients of
00472 // integral( |D + z Dbar|^2 ) where Dbar(m12,m13) = D(m13,m12)
00473 // Therefore this only works for C eigenstates. This is a design flaw.
00474 // This routine should be in BdkDKDalitz instead.
00475 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::calDDbarNorm(int nEvents)
00476 {
00477   cout << GetName() 
00478        << ": performing MC integration for D/Dbar interference" << endl;
00479 
00480   // Use ourself as intefering amplitude
00481   TVectorD p = calDIntNorm(0, nEvents);
00482 
00483   cout << "Precision of MC integration:"<<endl;
00484   cout << "p1/p0      = "<< p[1]/p[0] << endl;
00485   cout << "(p2-p3)/p2 = "<< (p[2]-p[3])/p[2] << endl;
00486 
00487   // Copy to RooRealVars
00488   _normReDDbar->setVal(p[0]);      
00489   _normImDDbar->setVal(0.0);         // Theoretically, p1 = 0
00490   _normDbarSqr->setVal((p[2]+p[3])/2);   // Theoretically, p2 = p3
00491   _normDSqr->setVal((p[2]+p[3])/2);
00492 }
00493 
00494 
00495 RooComplex BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::getamp(Double_t m12, Double_t m13) const
00496 {
00497   //This return the f(m+^2,m-^2)
00498   if (kFALSE == inDalitz(m12, m13)) {
00499     return RooComplex(0.0, 0.0);
00500   }
00501 
00502   if (_useAutoNorm) {
00503     // normalize (mutable operation) if need to:
00504     ((BdkAbsDDalitzAmp*)this)->calNorm(1000000, kFALSE); 
00505   }
00506   
00507   RooComplex dalitzamplitude(0,0);
00508 
00509   for (int i=0; i<_nComps; i++) {
00510 
00511     Double_t amp = _ampRes[i]->getVal();
00512     if (amp==0) continue;
00513 
00514     RooComplex coeff = RooComplex(amp * cos(_phaseRes[i]->getVal()*DEGTORAD),
00515                                   amp * sin(_phaseRes[i]->getVal()*DEGTORAD));    
00516 
00517     RooComplex matrixelement;
00518     if (_typeRes[i]==0) matrixelement = RelativisticBW(m12, m13, 
00519                                                        _massRes[i]->getVal(), 
00520                                                        _gammaRes[i]->getVal(), i)
00521                                       * SpinFactor(m12, m13, _spinRes[i], _trackinfo[i], i);
00522 
00523     else matrixelement = customME(m12, m13, i);
00524 
00525     dalitzamplitude = dalitzamplitude + coeff*matrixelement;
00526   }
00527   
00528   // In the PDF we will take abs2() for the amplitude, so need to
00529   // take sqrt() for efficiency map now:
00530 
00531   return (dalitzamplitude * sqrt(efficiency(m12,m13)));
00532 }
00533 
00534 // initialize one component:
00535 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::addComp(const char * name, double amp, double phase, 
00536                                double mass, double width, 
00537                                ResDaughters trackInfo, 
00538                                Int_t spin, Int_t parSource, Int_t resType) {
00539   
00540   _nameRes[_nComps] = TString(name); 
00541   
00542   _ampRes[_nComps] = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName()) + "."
00543                                     + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_amp", 
00544                                     TString(GetTitle()) + "."
00545                                     + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_amp", 
00546                                     amp);
00547   
00548   _phaseRes[_nComps] = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName()) + "."
00549                                       + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_phase", 
00550                                       TString(GetTitle()) + "."
00551                                       + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_phase", 
00552                                       phase);
00553   
00554   if (0 > parSource) { // make new mass and width parameters:
00555     _massRes[_nComps] = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName()) + "."
00556                                        + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_mass", 
00557                                        TString(GetTitle()) + "."
00558                                        + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_mass", mass);  
00559     
00560     _gammaRes[_nComps] = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName()) + "."
00561                                         + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_width",
00562                                         TString(GetTitle()) + "."
00563                                         + _nameRes[_nComps] + "_width", width);
00564   }
00565   else { // the mass and width for this resonance come from parSource:
00566     _massRes[_nComps] = _massRes[parSource];
00567     _gammaRes[_nComps] = _gammaRes[parSource];
00568   }
00569 
00570   // put these on the parameters list:
00571   _params.addOwned(*_ampRes[_nComps]);
00572   _params.addOwned(*_phaseRes[_nComps]);
00573   _params.addOwned(*_massRes[_nComps]);
00574   _params.addOwned(*_gammaRes[_nComps]);
00575 
00576   // User's responsibility to read normalization parameters or
00577   // normalize after initialization. Hence:
00578   _massResLast[_nComps] = _massRes[_nComps]->getVal();
00579   _gammaResLast[_nComps] = _gammaRes[_nComps]->getVal();
00580 
00581   // set spin and daughters code:
00582   _spinRes[_nComps] = spin;
00583   _trackinfo[_nComps] = trackInfo;
00584 
00585   // type of resonance (0 = default Breit-Wigner, otherwise call customME())
00586   _typeRes[_nComps] = resType;
00587 
00588   // update # of components:
00589   ++_nComps;  
00590 }
00591 
00592   
00593   
00594 // initialize the components:
00595 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::createParams() 
00596 {
00597   // create and store all RooRealVar normalization parameters:
00598   for (int j = 0; j < _nComps; ++j) {
00599     for (int k = 0; k < _nComps; ++k) {
00600 
00601       TString suffix;
00602       suffix += j;
00603       suffix += "_";
00604       suffix += k;
00605 
00606       TString nameReal(".normReal_");
00607       nameReal += suffix;
00608 
00609       TString nameImag(".normImag_");
00610       nameImag += suffix;
00611 
00612       _normReal[j][k] = new RooRealVar(GetName() + nameReal, 
00613                                        GetTitle() + nameReal,
00614                                        1.0);
00615 
00616       _normImag[j][k] = new RooRealVar(GetName() + nameImag, 
00617                                        GetTitle() + nameImag,
00618                                        1.0);
00619 
00620       _normParams.addOwned(*_normReal[j][k]);  
00621       _normParams.addOwned(*_normImag[j][k]); 
00622     }
00623   }
00624 
00625   // Add the D/Dbar inteference normalization parameters
00626 
00627   _normDSqr = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName())+".normDSqr", 
00628                              TString(GetTitle())+".normDSqr", 0);
00629 
00630   _normDbarSqr = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName())+".normDbarSqr", 
00631                                 TString(GetTitle())+".normDbarSqr", 0);
00632 
00633   _normReDDbar = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName())+".normReDDbar", 
00634                                 TString(GetTitle())+".normReDDbar", 0);
00635 
00636   _normImDDbar = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName())+".normImDDbar", 
00637                                 TString(GetTitle())+".normImDDbar", 0);
00638 
00639   _normParams.addOwned(*_normDSqr);
00640   _normParams.addOwned(*_normDbarSqr);
00641   _normParams.addOwned(*_normReDDbar);
00642   _normParams.addOwned(*_normImDDbar);
00643   
00644 
00645   // create the radial parameter for the Blatt-Weisskopf factor
00646   _resRadius = new RooRealVar(TString(GetName()) + ".resRadius",
00647                               TString(GetTitle()) + " resonance radius",
00648                               1.5);
00649   _params.addOwned(*_resRadius);
00650   
00651 }
00652 
00653 
00654 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::kinematics(Double_t m12, Double_t m13, Int_t n) const {
00655   Double_t value=0;
00656   
00657   //compute m23(invarient mass square) using energy and momentum conservation
00658   Double_t m23 = _mD*_mD + _mDaug[1]*_mDaug[1] + _mDaug[2]*_mDaug[2] + 
00659     _mDaug[3]*_mDaug[3] - m12 -m13;
00660   
00661   //Now need to determine which variables to return using the info from Int_t n,(bachler tracks)
00662   //convention n=1 -> m23, n=2 -> m13, n=3 -> m12
00663   
00664   switch (n) {
00665   case 1:
00666     value=m23;
00667     break;
00668   case 2:
00669     value=m13;
00670     break;
00671   case 3:
00672     value=m12;
00673     break;    
00674   }
00675   return value;
00676 }
00677 
00678 
00679 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::dampingFactorSquared(Double_t s, Int_t n, Int_t spin) const
00680 { 
00681   Double_t p = pionCMmom(s,n);
00682   Double_t R = _resRadius->getVal();
00683 
00684   switch (spin) {
00685   case 0: return 1;
00686   case 1: return (1 + R*R*p*p);
00687   case 2: return (9 + 3*R*R*p*p + R*R*R*R*p*p*p*p);
00688   default: return 1;
00689   }
00690 }
00691 
00692 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::FrEval(Double_t s, Double_t m0, Int_t n, Int_t spin) const
00693 {
00694   //  if (!aboveThreshold( s )) return 1;
00695 
00696   Double_t Fr2_s = dampingFactorSquared(s, n, spin);
00697   Double_t Fr2_m = dampingFactorSquared(m0*m0, n, spin);
00698 
00699   return sqrt(Fr2_s/Fr2_m);
00700 }
00701 
00702 
00703 
00704 RooComplex BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::RelativisticBW(Double_t m12, Double_t m13, 
00705                                             Double_t m0, Double_t width, 
00706                                             Int_t i) const 
00707 {
00708   //notice m12 and m13 are invarient mass "square" of the decay product
00709 
00710   //s is the invariant mass "square" M^2(ab)
00711   //m0 is the mass of the resonace
00712 
00713   Double_t s = kinematics(m12,m13,_trackinfo[i]);
00714   if (0 == _trackinfo[i] || 0 == _gammaRes[i]->getVal()) {
00715     // Take care the NonResonace Component is uniform over dalitz region.
00716     // Using the width to flag this works for pwave as well as swave.
00717     return RooComplex(1.0,0.0);   
00718   }
00719   else{    
00720     Double_t A = (m0*m0 - s);
00721     Double_t B = m0*runningWidth(m12,m13,m0,_gammaRes[i]->getVal(),_spinRes[i],_trackinfo[i]);
00722     Double_t C = A*A+B*B;
00723     
00724   assert (C != 0);
00725 
00726   Double_t Fr = FrEval(s, m0 ,_trackinfo[i], _spinRes[i]);
00727 
00728   return RooComplex(A/C, B/C)*Fr*F_D;
00729   }
00730 }
00731 
00732 // This method gets called if _typeRes[i] != 0 and can be overridden
00733 // in derived classes to implmenet custom matrix elements.
00734 RooComplex BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::customME(Double_t m12, Double_t m13, Int_t i) const
00735 {
00736   cout << "BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::customME() not implemented. Returning 0." << endl;
00737   return RooComplex(0,0);
00738 }
00739 
00740 //Try to introduce Relativistic Breit-Wigner function
00741 
00742 inline Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::betaKin( Double_t s, Double_t m ) const
00743 {
00744   Double_t rad = 1 - m*m/s;
00745   return (rad >= 0.0) ? sqrt( rad ) : 1;  
00746 }
00747 
00748 
00749 // For A -> B + C calculate momentum of B and C in rest frame of A 
00750 // s is center of mass energy squared (mass of A)
00751 // see (38.16) in PDG04
00752 inline Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::pionCMmom( Double_t s, Double_t m1, Double_t m2 ) const
00753 {
00754   return 0.5 * sqrt(s) * betaKin(s, m1+m2) * betaKin(s, m1-m2);
00755 }
00756 
00757 inline Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::pionCMmom(Double_t s, Int_t n) const
00758 {
00759  /*  
00760    index   resonance   dtr particles   dtr indices
00761      1       rho0        pi+ pi-         23
00762      2       rho-        pi0 pi-         13
00763      3       rho+        pi0 pi+         12
00764   */
00765   switch (n) {
00766   case 1: return pionCMmom(s, _mDaug[2], _mDaug[3]);
00767   case 2: return pionCMmom(s, _mDaug[3], _mDaug[1]);
00768   case 3: return pionCMmom(s, _mDaug[1], _mDaug[2]);
00769   default: return 0;
00770   }
00771 }
00772 
00773 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::runningWidth(Double_t m12, Double_t m13, Double_t m0,
00774                                         Double_t width, Int_t spin, Int_t n) const
00775 {
00776   if (_useFixedWidth) return width;
00777 
00778   Double_t s = kinematics(m12,m13,n);  // invariant mass squared of daugthers
00779 
00780   Double_t k_s  = pionCMmom(s, n);
00781   Double_t k_m0 = pionCMmom(m0*m0, n);   // using nominal resonance mass
00782 
00783   Double_t Fr = FrEval(s, m0, n, spin);
00784 
00785   // The following loop replaces this: r = pow(k_s/k_m0, 2*spin+1)
00786   // Note: x^(2*n+1) = x*(x*x)^n
00787   Double_t x = k_s/k_m0;
00788   Double_t r = x;
00789   for (int i=0; i<spin; i++) r *= (x*x);
00790     
00791   return width * m0/sqrt(s) * r * Fr*Fr;
00792 }
00793 
00794 
00795 Double_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::SpinFactor(Double_t m12, Double_t m13, Int_t spin, 
00796                                    Int_t n, Int_t i) const
00797 {
00798   Double_t value;
00799     
00800   if (_trackinfo[i]==0) {
00801     value = 1.0;   //take care the NonResonace Component is uniform over dalitz region
00802   }
00803   else {
00804     
00805     Double_t m23;
00806     Double_t a1, b1, c1;
00807     Double_t mAC=0, mBC=0, mAB=0;
00808     Double_t _mA=0, _mB=0, _mC=0;
00809     
00810     //Reminder:
00811     //_mDaug[1]=Pi0
00812     //_mDaug[2]=pi+
00813     //_mDaug[3]=pi-
00814     
00815     
00816     //compute m23(invarient mass square) using energy and momentum conservation
00817     m23 = _mD*_mD + _mDaug[1]*_mDaug[1] + _mDaug[2]*_mDaug[2] + _mDaug[3]*_mDaug[3] - m12 -m13;    
00818     switch (n) {  //n is the _trackinfo 
00819     case 1: //pi+ pi- is resonace pair
00820       _mA=_mDaug[2]; //pi+
00821       _mB=_mDaug[3]; //pi-
00822       _mC=_mDaug[1]; //Pi0
00823       mAC=m12;
00824       mBC=m13;
00825       mAB=m23;
00826       break;
00827     case 2: //Pi0 pi- is the resonance pair (Cabibbo allow decay)
00828       _mA=_mDaug[3]; //Pi-
00829       _mB=_mDaug[1]; //pi0
00830       _mC=_mDaug[2]; //pi+
00831       mAC=m23;
00832       mBC=m12;
00833       mAB=m13;
00834       break;
00835     case 3: //pi0 pi+ is the resonace pair (Cabibbo suppress decay)
00836       _mA=_mDaug[1]; //Pi0
00837       _mB=_mDaug[2]; //pi-
00838       _mC=_mDaug[3]; //pi+
00839       mAC=m13;
00840       mBC=m23;
00841       mAB=m12;
00842       break;
00843     }
00844 
00845     double massFactor = 1./(_massRes[i]->getVal()*_massRes[i]->getVal());
00846     if (_enforceTransversality) {
00847       massFactor = 1./mAB;
00848     }
00849     
00850     switch (spin) {
00851     case 0: 
00852       value = 1;
00853       break;
00854     case 1:      //spin 1 case
00855       value = ((mAC-mBC) + (massFactor*(_mD*_mD - _mC*_mC)*(_mB*_mB-_mA*_mA)));
00856       break;
00857     case 2:
00858       a1 = sqr((mBC-mAC) + (massFactor*(_mD*_mD - _mC*_mC)*(_mA*_mA-_mB*_mB)));
00859       b1 = (mAB-(2*_mD*_mD)-(2*_mC*_mC))+massFactor*sqr(_mD*_mD-_mC*_mC);
00860       c1 = (mAB-(2*_mA*_mA)-(2*_mB*_mB))+massFactor*sqr(_mA*_mA-_mB*_mB);
00861       value =  a1-((1/3.0)*b1*c1);
00862       break;
00863     default:
00864       cout << "BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::SpinFactor() cannot handle spin>2 resonances."<<endl;
00865       value = 1;
00866       assert(spin<3);
00867     }
00868   }
00869 
00870   return value;
00871 }
00872 
00873 
00874 // Coupled channel Breit-Wigner function for a0(980)
00875 // gXX are the squared coupling constants!
00876 RooComplex BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::a0Amp(Double_t s, Double_t m0,
00877                                    Double_t gEtaPi, Double_t gKK) const
00878 {
00879 
00880   //  Double_t m0 = 0.998;
00881   //  Double_t gEtaPi = 0.105;        
00882   //  Double_t gKK   = 0.102;   
00883 
00884   Double_t mSumSq1_ = 4.0*BdkDalitz::ETAMASS*BdkDalitz::PI0MASS;
00885   Double_t mSumSq2_ = 4.0*sqr(BdkDalitz::KMASS);
00886   Double_t mSumSq3_ = 4.0*sqr(BdkDalitz::K0MASS);
00887 
00888   Double_t dMSq = m0*m0 - s;
00889 
00890   Double_t rho1(0.0), rho2(0.0);
00891 
00892     if (s > mSumSq1_) {
00893       rho1 += TMath::Sqrt(1.0 - mSumSq1_/s);
00894       if (s > mSumSq2_) {
00895         rho2 = 0.5*TMath::Sqrt(1.0 - mSumSq2_/s);
00896         if (s > mSumSq3_) {
00897           rho2 += 0.5*TMath::Sqrt(1.0 - mSumSq3_/s);
00898         } else {
00899           // Continue analytically below higher channel thresholds
00900           // This contributes to the real part of the amplitude denominator
00901           dMSq += gKK*m0*0.5*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq3_/s - 1.0);
00902         }
00903       } else {
00904         // Continue analytically below higher channel thresholds
00905         // This contributes to the real part of the amplitude denominator
00906         rho2 = 0.0;
00907         dMSq += gKK*m0*(0.5*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq2_/s - 1.0) + 0.5*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq3_/s - 1.0));
00908       }
00909     } else {
00910       // Continue analytically below higher channel thresholds
00911       // This contributes to the real part of the amplitude denominator
00912       dMSq += gEtaPi*m0*2.0*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq1_/s - 1.0);
00913     }
00914 
00915   Double_t widthTerm = gEtaPi*rho1*m0 + gKK*rho2*m0;  
00916   RooComplex resAmplitude = RooComplex(dMSq, widthTerm);  
00917   Double_t denomFactor = dMSq*dMSq + widthTerm*widthTerm;  
00918   Double_t invDenomFactor = 0.0;
00919   if (denomFactor > 1e-10) {invDenomFactor = 1.0/denomFactor;}  
00920   resAmplitude = resAmplitude*(invDenomFactor);
00921 
00922   return resAmplitude;
00923 }
00924 
00925 
00926 
00927 
00928 // Coupled channel Breit-Wigner function for f0(980)
00929 // gXX are the squared coupling constants!
00930 RooComplex BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::f0Amp(Double_t s, Double_t m0,
00931                                    Double_t gPiPi, Double_t gKK) const
00932 {
00933   //  Double_t gPiPi = 0.165;        // +/- 0.010 +/- 0.015 GeV/c^2
00934   //  Double_t gKK   = gPiPi*4.21;   // +/- 0.25 +/- 0.21
00935 
00936   Double_t mSumSq0_ = 4.0*sqr(BdkDalitz::PI0MASS);
00937   Double_t mSumSq1_ = 4.0*sqr(BdkDalitz::PIMASS);
00938   Double_t mSumSq2_ = 4.0*sqr(BdkDalitz::KMASS);
00939   Double_t mSumSq3_ = 4.0*sqr(BdkDalitz::K0MASS);
00940 
00941   Double_t dMSq = m0*m0 - s;
00942 
00943   Double_t rho1(0.0), rho2(0.0);
00944   if (s > mSumSq0_) {
00945     rho1 = TMath::Sqrt(1.0 - mSumSq0_/s)/3.0;
00946     if (s > mSumSq1_) {
00947       rho1 += 2.0*TMath::Sqrt(1.0 - mSumSq1_/s)/3.0;
00948       if (s > mSumSq2_) {
00949         rho2 = 0.5*TMath::Sqrt(1.0 - mSumSq2_/s);
00950         if (s > mSumSq3_) {
00951           rho2 += 0.5*TMath::Sqrt(1.0 - mSumSq3_/s);
00952         } else {
00953           // Continue analytically below higher channel thresholds
00954           // This contributes to the real part of the amplitude denominator
00955           dMSq += gKK*m0*0.5*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq3_/s - 1.0);
00956         }
00957       } else {
00958         // Continue analytically below higher channel thresholds
00959         // This contributes to the real part of the amplitude denominator
00960         rho2 = 0.0;
00961         dMSq += gKK*m0*(0.5*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq2_/s - 1.0) + 0.5*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq3_/s - 1.0));
00962       }
00963     } else {
00964       // Continue analytically below higher channel thresholds
00965       // This contributes to the real part of the amplitude denominator
00966       dMSq += gPiPi*m0*2.0*TMath::Sqrt(mSumSq1_/s - 1.0)/3.0;
00967     }
00968   }
00969   
00970   Double_t widthTerm = gPiPi*rho1*m0 + gKK*rho2*m0;  
00971   RooComplex resAmplitude = RooComplex(dMSq, widthTerm);  
00972   Double_t denomFactor = dMSq*dMSq + widthTerm*widthTerm;  
00973   Double_t invDenomFactor = 0.0;
00974   if (denomFactor > 1e-10) {invDenomFactor = 1.0/denomFactor;}  
00975   resAmplitude = resAmplitude*(invDenomFactor);
00976 
00977   return resAmplitude;
00978 }

00982 
00983 Bool_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::inDalitz(Double_t m12, Double_t m13) const
00984 {
00985   return _pdf->inDalitz(m12, m13);
00986 }
00987 
00988 // Check if component j needs to be normalized:
00989 Bool_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::needToNormalize(int j) const {
00990 
00991   double minDiff = 1e-4;
00992   if (_gammaRes[j]->getVal()>0) minDiff = _gammaRes[j]->getVal() / 20.;
00993     
00994   if (fabs(_massRes[j]->getVal() - _massResLast[j]) > minDiff ||
00995       fabs(_gammaRes[j]->getVal() - _gammaResLast[j]) > minDiff) {
00996     return kTRUE;
00997   }
00998   return kFALSE;
00999 }
01000 
01001 Bool_t BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::needToNormalizeAny() const {
01002   Bool_t result = kFALSE;
01003 
01004   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {
01005     if (needToNormalize(j)) {
01006       result = kTRUE;
01007       
01008       if (verbose().Contains("n")) {
01009         cout << GetName() << ": need to normalize " << _nameRes[j] << endl;
01010       }
01011       else {
01012         // break out of the loop if not printing what needs to be
01013         // normalized. If printing, then finish the loop in order to
01014         // print everything.
01015         break;  
01016       }
01017     }
01018   }
01019 
01020   return result;
01021 }       
01022 
01023 // Reset normalization-needed flags: 
01024 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::setIsNormalized() {
01025   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {
01026     _massResLast[j] = _massRes[j]->getVal();
01027     _gammaResLast[j] = _gammaRes[j]->getVal();
01028   }
01029 }
01030 
01031 // Change the last mass so that the component is flagged as needing to
01032 // be normalized:
01033 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::setNeedToNormalize(int component) {
01034   _massResLast[component] = _massRes[component]->getVal() + 1;
01035 }
01036 
01037 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::setNeedToNormalizeAll() {
01038   for(int j=0;j<_nComps;j++) {
01039     setNeedToNormalize(j);
01040   }
01041 }
01042 
01043 void BdkAbsDDalitzAmp::printDDbarNorm() const
01044 {
01045   RooArgSet set(*_normDSqr, *_normDbarSqr, 
01046                 *_normReDDbar, *_normImDDbar);
01047 
01048   set.Print("v");
01049 }
